user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_upgraded_connection_mark_app_closed_:
```c
void
MHD_upgraded_connection_mark_app_closed_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  /* Cache 'daemon' here to avoid data races */
  struct MHD_Daemon *const daemon = connection->daemon;
#if defined(MHD_USE_THREADS)
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->worker_pool);
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */
  mhd_assert (NULL != connection->urh);
  mhd_assert (0 != (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME));

  MHD_mutex_lock_chk_ (&daemon->cleanup_connection_mutex);
  connection->urh->was_closed = true;
  connection->resuming = true;
  daemon->resuming = true;
  MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (&daemon->cleanup_connection_mutex);
  if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "r")) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Failed to signal resume via " \
                 "inter-thread communication channel.\n"));
#endif
  }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No definite unreachable code fragments were found in this function. The function contains no unconditional return, infinite loop, goto, or switch/case constructs that would make subsequent statements unreachable. Conditional constructs are: the preprocessor guards (#if defined(MHD_USE_THREADS) and #ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES) which simply include or exclude code at compile time (not making any remaining code unreachable), and a runtime if (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_(daemon->itc) && !MHD_itc_activate_(...)) whose truth value cannot be determined from this snippet alone — therefore it cannot be classified as statically unreachable. The mhd_assert calls may abort at runtime when a condition fails, but assertions do not constitute statically unreachable code in the source as required by MISRA Rule 2.1. Consequently, there are no source fragments in this function that can be conclusively identified as unreachable and needing further investigation.
